result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Daniel J Figueroa in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Defendant Daniel J Figueroa in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case 15CF1436 for the purposes of sentencing.  Status conference scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel J Figueroa in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Defendant Daniel J Figueroa in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 6/15/15 in Branch 40.  On motion of the state, Court ordered 15CF1436 and 15CF1779 joined for the purpose of trial.   Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
from the defense received and filed.  rmm
Notice of motion and motion to modify bail from the defense received and filed. Bail review scheduled for 05/20/2015 at 1:30.
Victim, Melinda A., appeared to request modification of the no contact order.  Court declined modification of the no contact order.   mld

Defendant Daniel J Figueroa in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Defendant Daniel J Figueroa in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for Michael Schindhelm for the State of Wisconsin.  
Br 4 for Br. 40.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Discovery received by defense counsel.  Offer is needed by defense counsel.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  Upon the motion of the State, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial: Cases 2015CF1436 and 2015CF1779.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 40 on 5-19-2015 at 1:30 pm and Jury Trial on 6-15-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
Due to Court calendar congestion case spun to Branch 4. Case sent forthwith.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Melinda A.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Daniel J Figueroa in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Daniel J Figueroa in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Defese entered pleas of NOT GUILTY to Counts 1 and 2. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
